title: My experience with Global Entrepreneurship & Innovation Week 2025
excerpt: Retour sur ma participation au Hackathon AI Vigilante 2025 √† l'ENSET Mohammedia, une exp√©rience marquante ax√©e sur l'innovation technologique au service de l'int√©grit√© acad√©mique.
author: Sara Damri
content:
Global Entrepreneurship Innovation Week ‚Äì ENSET Challenge 2025

The Global Entrepreneurship Innovation Week 2025 was held from April 20 to 22, 2025, at ENSET Mohammedia. The event aimed to promote innovation, encourage entrepreneurship, and inspire students to explore entrepreneurial careers.

## ENSET Challenge Participation

During the event, I participated in the ENSET Challenge, organized by:
- Google Developer Groups on Campus ‚Äì ENSET Mohammedia
- N7 Geeks Aggregation
- N7 SECURITY CLUB

## First Round ‚Äì Project Submission

Our team developed an interactive project addressing societal issues using AI, within 48 hours. We were proud to be selected among the top 10 finalist teams for the next phase: a 36-hour hackathon.

## Hackathon AI Vigilante 2025

In the hackathon‚Äôs opening hour, the theme was revealed: 

> *"Technological Innovations Against Academic Fraud in the Digital Age."

We worked non-stop for 36 hours to build a prototype tool for detecting similarities and suspicious behavior during online exams using:
- Machine learning algorithms
- Real-time behavioral analysis

## Key Highlights

###  Inspirational Talks
Experts such as Oumayma Essarhi, Hamza AIT BEN YISSA, Ismail El Azizi, Mohannad TAZI, and Dr. Leila NAIM TIWARI shared insights on academic fraud and AI‚Äôs evolving role in combating it.

###  Mentorship Support
Guidance from our professors and mentors was instrumental:
OUAGUID Abdellah, Mohamed Youssfi, Soufiane Hamida, Bouchra Bouihi, Abderrahim Chalfaouat, Azeddine KHIAT

###  Smooth Organization
Thanks to the organizing team for top-notch logistics, relaxation spaces, food, and an inspiring atmosphere.

## A Human and Technical Experience

This hackathon was more than just a technical challenge‚Äîit was a human adventure. I learned to manage stress, resolve creative differences, and lead a team through fatigue at 4 a.m.

## Achievement

üèÜ We won 3rd place and received great feedback on our idea‚Äôs relevance and technical implementation. It was incredibly rewarding.

## Looking Ahead

This experience fueled my interest in projects with social impact, especially in education and digital ethics. It also strengthened my commitment to:
- Academic integrity
- Transparency
- Responsible tech development

## Final Thoughts

GWIE ‚Äì ENSET Challenge 2025 will remain one of the most meaningful experiences of my academic journey‚Äîdemanding, inspiring, and purposeful.

Thanks to ENSET Mohammedia, the speakers, mentors, and my amazing team!

title: Getting Started with React: A Comprehensive Guide
excerpt: Learn the fundamentals of React.js and build your first interactive web application with this step-by-step guide.
author: Sara Damri
content:
React has revolutionized the way we build user interfaces. In this comprehensive guide, we'll explore the core concepts of React and build a practical application from scratch. ## What is React? React is a JavaScript library for building user interfaces, particularly web applications. It was developed by Facebook and has become one of the most popular frontend frameworks. ### Key Features: - **Component-Based**: Build encapsulated components that manage their own state - **Virtual DOM**: Efficient updates and rendering - **Learn Once, Write Anywhere**: Use React for web, mobile, and desktop applications ## Setting Up Your Development Environment Before we start coding, let's set up our development environment: ```bash npx create-react-app my-first-app cd my-first-app npm start ``` ## Creating Your First Component Let's create a simple component: ```jsx function Welcome(props) { return

Hello, {props.name}!

; } ``` This is just the beginning of your React journey. Stay tuned for more advanced topics!
